content: So, I believe we're now running new link preview code here, where if you send a message that just contains a link to an image, we just show the image visually. I'll demonstrate in my next message.
I'd like to get some feedback on how folks feel about that user experience.
I assume the cat's upside down, and not the preview, haha. :crying_cat_face:
Yep :)
It's not completely clear to me how I'd get to the actual link, if I wanted to do that.
Yeah, you need to click on it and then click "open" from the lightbox.
(Or use "view source", but that's even more advanced). I feel like we may need to do something better there.
@Brock Whittaker any ideas?
I feel like "go to site" or something similar would be more clear than "open".
You can Right Click and Copy Image Location.
Oh yeah, that works too.
The reason "Open" is unintuitive to me is that I already "opened" the image.
"Open" is a very open-ended word (pun intended) if you don't add a noun to it.
We should look at what other sites do for this sort of thing. Slack has an icon like this: pasted image with a title of "Open original", which is a bit confusing, but not bad.
I kinda like the idea of just replacing the open/download strings with icons, since there are really good standard icons for these.

Google Image Search says "Visit".

pasted image
Suggestion: show such icons on hover since anyone interested in an image link would try to interact with it.
I think both "Open original" and "Visit" are more clear than plain "Open", and we piggyback on people being familiar with either Slack or Google.

I think windows users will intuitively right click the image. As far as I'm concerned it's better now than before and I don't miss any buttons to interact with the image. If I want to see it enlarged, I click it. If I want the URL, I right click it. Simple.
